column1: 130kph, angled down the leg side, he can't catch up with it trying to glance
131kph, full outside off, angling in slightly then a hint of shape away, he lets this go
129kph,flash and miss trying to drive. This was full and wide but it swung very late away, past the flashing edge
good length, fourth stump line, he presses forward and plays a rock solid forward defence to mid off
129kph, good length, angling in, swinging away, fifth stump line, he leaves alone
129kph, good length, fifth stump line, tailing away, he leaves it alone
136kph, back of a length, this bounces and surprises him, he's jumping and fending off the shoulder of the bat, awkwardly, it falls safe on the pitch
135kph, banged in outside off, he shapes to pull and misses it by a long way as it was very wide of off
cracking pull shot! Short outside off and he climbed into this after missing the last one, he hammered through midwicket
138kph, good length fourth stump line angled in, he pushes with firm hands to the gap and cover and rotates the strike
full and angled way wide of off and swings wider, he watches it go past and Pant takes it in front of first slip
142kph, fuller length, he's driving, slicing it along the ground square to point
133kph, good length, fifth stump line, no shape in, he leaves it
136kph, good length outside off, he takes a positive stride into the ball and defends it into the gap at cover for a single. Nicely played
129kph, good length, angled in and straightening, he defends off the outside half of the bat on the front foot to point
126kph, back of a length outside off, he's happy to leave on length but it is wide of off
129kph, good length, on off, he's forward squared up a touch defending to point
128kph, sprayed way down the leg side and Pant has to dive to clean it up
139kph, angled into middle and off, he clips this with the angle, lovely timing working it wide of mid on
143kph, good length angling in a touch but it's fifth stump line and he shoulders arms watchfully
142kph, good length, angled into fourth stump line, he defends coming forward, it hits high on the bat
beaten. Great delivery. Full outside off, he went to drive and it nipped off the seam away, past the edge
shorter inswinger, cuts him in half, beats the inside edge, going between bat and body through to Pant
140kph, full, angled into middle, he nudges this with the angle wide of mid on
130kph, big hooping inswinger, back of a length, he tries to whip but it hits the thigh pad, no appeal as is was going over and down leg
128kph, full and well wide of off, Finch looks to drive bat drags it off the inside half back to the bowler
128kph, good length, angled into off, he defends with firm hands and a full face on the walk to mid on
beaten by a good length. He played all around this. Had no idea really just poking outside off. Great delivery, angled in and seamed away from a great length
134kph, big inswinger that tails way down the leg side
130kph, good length, angled into off, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid on
138kph, inside edge onto pad defending on the front foot. It was a great length but he could have left it, parried back onto his pads and it rolls away safely
good length, angled well across the left hander and he leave this alone
good length,  well wide of off, he leaves alone again
141kph, full inswinger, middle and leg line, he glances this down to fine leg to get off the mark
full outside off, it shapes away a touch he plays a nice check drive to Jadeja at mid off

140kph, thick edge well wide of gully and it races away! Short and lifting wide of off, he played away from his body with a vertical bat and got a thick edge that flew very square well wide of gully. Dangerous stroke on this wicket
fine leg glance to the fence. This was very full swinging down leg, he gets a little tickle and it is just wide of Pant
128kph, he oversteps, good length, fourth stump he leaves this
good length, well wide of off and swinging wider and he watches it go past
124kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to mid off
128kph, beautiful on drive straight of mid on! This was floated up on middle and he just punches through the line on the front foot and times it magnificently
this one is straight of mid off! A gift of a half-volley to Harris and he plays a comfortable drive, not overhitting it, placing between the bowler and mid off and it flies to the rope
127kph, beaten on the inside edge. Good length angled back in, he made a late decision to try and defending but it zipped between the bat and body
wide of the crease, full angled into a fourth stump line, he defends back to the bowler
144kph, good length outside off, he's half forward defending off the edge with soft hands along the ground to gully
142kph, wide of the crease, angled into off, he's pressing forward and pushing back to the bowler
141kph, good length, outside off, he defends off the front foot to the gap at cover
full on a fourth stump line, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid off
140kph, good length, well wide of off and he's happy to let this go
132kph, some outswing first up, this is well wide of off and swinging wider, he leaves this alone
good length outswinger, fifth stump line, he raises the bat high and allows it to pass through
back of a length, he's back and across and pushing firmly off the back foot to mid off
good length, fifth stump line, he pushes on the front foot with an open face to point
nearly a run out! He pushed off the front foot towards cover but Kohli was very close at mid off and swooper, Harris screamed 'NO' and Finch had to turn around and dive back to beat the throw
pushes into cover firmer this time and takes one, Kohli fields and throws and hits at the non-strikers and it ricochets away from the man backing up! They get two more on top of the single
angled into leg stump and he clips this away neatly though the vacant midwicket region and they get three
138kph, back of a length way wide of off, he's leaving this alone
136kph, back of a length, extra bounce, he's squared up a bit on the back off, he defends with soft hands running into the gully

glorious cover drive, overpitched and he punches beautifully through the line, it runs all the way to the rope and Kohli makes an outstanding rolling save. Did he touch the rope? No just pulled in inches from the rope. Brilliant
141kph, good length, wide of the crease angled in but he can leave on line and length
140kph, fuller, fifth stump line, he gets a big stride in to defend on the front foot
139kph, good length angled across the left-hander and he leaves this alone
magnificent off drive! He was so compact stepping into this half-volley and placing this straight of mid off with minimal effort
good length, well wide of off and again he's happy to leave
136kph, good length, outside off, angling wider, he leaves it alone
136kph, good length, off stump line, he defends from the crease back to the bowler

runs this past gully! But this wasn't in control. It was a shorter length, angled across, he just hung the bat out but it hit the middle and ran off the face wide of gully and it raced away. He didn't intend to get that there.

Huge LBW shout. Given not out. Looked high. Kohli after a long chat decides to review. Good length, not swinging, straightening back in. It beat the edge and hit above the knee roll. No bat. Ball tracking has it going over! Good decision from Chris Gaffaney. Going over. India lose a review
Another shout for LBW! Again not out! Carbon copy. Again too high. Kohli opts not to review this one
fuller length outside off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
good length, off stump, he defends awkwardly on the front foot
fuller length, fourth stump line, he presses forward and defends to mid off
136kph, good length, fifth stump line, he pushes on the front foot to cover
fuller length, angling across, fourth stump line, he defends comfortably on the front foot
137kph, good length on middle, he pushes with the full face back to the bowler
good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot to mid off
beaten by a beauty! Good length, 139kph, seams across the left hander, squares him up and beats him all ends up
139kph, good length, probing off stump line, he defends on the front foot to mid off
137kph, full into leg stump and he's picked off, neat clip from Harris through square midwicket
back of a length, defended to mid-off
touch fuller, at off stump, 135kph and defended on the front foot
gets forward to a length delivery, defends
back of a length outside off, 138kph, left alone and reaches Pant at waist height
pushes this one fuller at off stump, leans forward and plays to mid-off
a shorter delivery outside off, 133kph, left alone
too straight, full at middle and leg, whipped off his pads in front of square
that's a pretty tight leave! And there's a strangled appeal for lbw. Good length and shapes back a touch, clips his pocket on the way to the keeper
works a length ball to the leg side
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended to the covers
a short delivery outside off, he gets over the top if it and square drives through point to bring up the fifty stand
gets back on a fuller length at the stumps, defended back down the pitch
a big appeal for lbw as this nips back off a length into Finch, but again it's taken him above the knee roll
that's a good spot from Shami, a good length at off stump, defended
pushes firmly forward at a full delivery and plays into the covers
short of a length outside off, gets on his toes and punches back up the pitch
back of a length outside off, 135kph, left alone
gets across onto off stump and works a full delivery into midwicket
lovely looking stroke from Finch and he drills a straight drive, but Umesh manages to get his right boot on it (then ends up in a heap for his efforts)
confidently forward again and driving to mid-on
clips a full delivery from off stump to mid-on
driven into the covers
short of a length at off stump, 138kph, gets behind the line and tucks into midwicket
good length outside off, 136kph, left alone
round the wicket, Harris takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works it round the corner to fine leg
good length outside off, 135kph, he walks into into and takes a thick inside edge that bobbles towards square leg
full outside off, left alone
touch wider outside off, shapes away a little, comfortably left alone
good length outside off, defended on the front foot to cover
short of a length, on the back foot and defends
full outside off, left alone
that's a poor ball but he gets away with it, short and wide outside off, Finch cuts firmly but it's intercepted at point
tries to get forward to a shortish delivery, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
round the wicket, short of a length at off stump, 136kph, defended into midwicket
defended to mid-on from quite high on the bat
angled into the pads, he rolls his wrists and works it down to fine leg
over the wicket, full at off stump, defended
angled across outside off, 132kph, left alone
length ball at off stump, defended with soft hands to the off side
this is fuller outside off, brings Harris forward and he drives to mid-off
pushed across outside off to the left hander, shoulders arms
full again outside off, 130kph, Ishant certainly not at top speed, this is driven to mid-off
that's a play and a miss as he aims a booming drive through the off side, Bumrah pitching this very full outside off
pulls the length back a little, also a touch wider, left alone
good length outside off, defended to the covers
short of a length, angles in from outside off, Bumrah quite wide on the crease, defended
full outside off, 141kph, Finch strides forward then leaves alone
same spot, full outside off, and the same leave alone
back of a length, defended
a bouncer, haven't seen many of those today, skims over Harris top edge as he goes for the pull...got big on him
full outside off, left alone
short outside off, he plays it in front of square off the back foot
in the channel outside off, pulls the bat out of the line
this one is a little wider and is left harmlessly through to the keeper
141kph, beats the outside edge as Finch comes forward into a drive
beaten again as he comes forward to drive, Finch not looking especially secure at the moment
back of a length outside off, 143kph, he walks into a defensive push which finds point
edged but wide of second slip, coming forward into a length ball, takes a thick outside edge but was well short and wide of the cordon
and now he beats the edge again, Finch pushing away from his body at a delivery he could probably have left alone
well bowled, this one nips back and takes a thick inside edge into the pads...that's a very good over from Bumrah
left alone outside off
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length outside off, 131kph, Harris has enough time to comfortable use his wrists to open the face into point
nice bit of a timing as he eases onto the front foot and pushes this straight of mid-on...much better shape from Finch on that occasion
very full, on the popping crease, dug out to the covers
full outside off, left alone
full at off stump, 141kph, driven to cover
full outside off, left alone
good length, angling in at off stump, defended
he's squeezed this off an inside edge to the leg side, the Indians were about to go up for a big lbw shout
tight line and length, at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length, touch wider outside off, Finch stretches forward and defends
round the wicket, full outside off, Harris is forward and pushes to the covers
length ball, slipping into the pads, no contact from Finch and it deflects behind square
round the wicket, back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
full outside off, left alone
back of a length, shapes in towards off stump but wide enough to leave...it barely carries through to Pant
wide outside off, an easy one to watch go through
129kph, good length outswinger that is well wide of off and swinging wider, he leaves this alone
133kph, drives on the up square of cover. Positive stroke. It wasn't a half-volley and it was shaping but he got a good stride in and pushed it wide of cover on the front foot
137kph, fuller length, shaping into off, he defends on the front foot from the middle of the bat
136kph, swinging into middle, he drives on the front foot to mid on
good length but into the thigh of Harris and he tucks it easily to fine leg
135kph, good length fourth stump line and he makes a decisive leave
132kph, loosener, wide of off, and he watches it go through to the keeper
brilliant square drive on the up! It wasn't a half-volley but he offered width and Harris crunched this through forward point, right out of the screws and it flew to the fence
A grubber! Woweee! This was back of a length, outside off, he went back and it shot low straight under the bat past off stump! That is startling.
smashes another square drive through cover-point! This was a volley and he held the pose with a classical left handers square drive and did not bother running
135kph, good length, well wide of off and he leaves
135kph, good length angled into off stump, he covers up going back and across
good length on off stump, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
136kph, good length, fourth stump line, he presses forward and defends to cover
135kph, good length outside off, he pushes forward and defends getting a thick edge along the ground to gully
135kph, good length outswinger outside off stump, he leaves this alone
134kph, good length outswinger, fifth stump line and he leaves it alone
132kph, shorter length he wafts a cut shot at it and misses! He is angry with himself for getting sucked in. It was too close to cut
135kph, play and miss prodding wide of off. Dangerous stroke this. It was a good length well wide, it tailed away and he just poked at it as it nipped past the edge
135kph, good length well wide of off, tailing away again and he leaves this time
135kph, good length, angling in and straightening, he's back and defending to cover
overpitched and square driven again through the vacant point region. It was too full and he pushed the hands through it and timed it beautifully
shorter on off, he's back and tucking into midwicket for a single.Harris reaches 50. His first Test half-century. He's played really well
short and wide and cracked through cover-point! This was a bad ball. Just a drag down wide of off and Finch crunched a cut shot through the gap at cover-point
135kph, shorter length on leg stump, he tucks this off the hip to square leg
135kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and working this through square leg to the sweeper
135kph, back of a length on middle, he's stands tall on the back foot and defends
137kph, he slices a drive on the up through backward point to the sweeper. Slightly loose stroke
134kph, shorter on off stump, he's squared up but he defends with soft hands onto the pitch
136kph, angled into leg stump, he tucks this with the angle to fine leg
136kph, shorter length on off, he's back and working this from the off stump line behind square on the leg side to the man in the deep
138kph beats the outside edge. Back of a length angled in and nipping away, he's squared up as it flies past the edge
beaten again slightly fuller, but a similar ball, angling in and seaming away, Harris keeps his hands in line and it goes past the edge
shorter into the hip and Harris glances with the angle to fine leg
138kph, fuller length, outside off, he tries to drive down the ground but drags it to mid on
137kph, good length off stump, he's back and defending back to the bowler
137kph, good length on off, he defends back to the bowler on the front foot
136kph, good length angled across him, well wide of off, he leaves this alone
this bouncer flies off the surface and way over the keeper's head! This took off! It hit a trampoline halfway down
good length outside off and he lets this go through to the keeper
cracking bouncer that follows him, he drops the knees and sways inside the line
135kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to cover
135kph, back of a length outside off, he defends off the back foot and it runs off a thick inside edge behind square
good length, well wide of off, he's happy to let this pass
134kph, wider of the crease, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
135kph, back of a length, he's on the back foot knocking this down wide of the gully to take a single. Century partnership is up
shorter outside off, he's up on his toes punching off the back foot very well through cover, great timing
fuller length outside off, he pushes firmly on the front foot to cover
134kph, good length outside off, sixth stump line, he lets this go through to the keeper
driven against the spin between cover and mid off! Glorious shot first up
square drives this time through cover-point! Two in a row! This was very full and wide and cracked away through the gap to the long boundary
88kph, flatter outside off, no turn, he's back and pushing this off the outside half to cover-point
flatter again, no turn, slight leading edge as he tries to turn to leg, it runs to point
he's back and nudging into the gap at cover. Fifty for Finch. A very good answer to the questions about his place at the top of the order.
full, drifting into off, yorker length, he squeezes it out
141kph, shorter length, nipping back, hits the pad, big appeal for LBW, but given not out. It was very high. No review

LBW! Plumb. This was fired full and straight at 140kph, it was a half-volley but Finch wiped across it, missed, and was hit flush on the shin in front of middle. Not problems for Chris Gaffaney to raise the finger. Well bowled Jasprit Bumrah
beats him first up with a cracker! 142kph, fired into off, perfect length, jagged away, Khawaja squared up on the crease. Wow.
142kph, good length, wider and again prodigious seam movement, but he is able to leave this
140kph, good length, fifth stump line, he leaves this alone wide of off
beaten again! What a ripper! 142kph, back of a length angled in, seaming away and it climbed off a length past the edge as he's squared up again
good length angled into middle, he defends with the angle to midwicket
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to cover
131kph, good length, angled into middle, he pushes on the front foot to mid on
130kph, back of a length, sixth stump line, wide of off, he leaves it alone
130kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot to mid off
124kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot, again with a rock solid compactness
142kph, good length, angling in a touch and wobbling away wide of off, he's happy to leave from the crease
good length angled into off, he's caught in the crease, defending on the front foot to mid on
138kph, back of a length, straightening, he's squared up defending on the back foot into the off side
142kph, angled in, good length and it holds it's line, he leaves positively but it wasn't that far from off stump
146kph, fuller inswinger, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
143kph, good length way wide of off, he's happy to leave this out of the hand
129kph, tight leave, on length, it was angled in, good length, and he let it pass nearly over off stump. Good leave in the end on this wicket
waft and miss. Awful shot. Back of a length outside off, nipping away, he wafts at it with no footwork and misses as it flies through to Pant
129kph, good length, fourth stump line, he wisely leaves this
130kph, shorter length, into the ribs, he's back and across comfortably and knocking this to square leg
133kph, very full, he drives without great timing to cover. Kohli fields and strangely fires at the striker's end and no one is backing up! They get an overthrow as it rolls to fine leg
128kph, good length outside off, he's leaving this outside off
stays round the wicket, back of a length outside off, left alone
this one jumps at Khawaja was from just short of a good length, pulls his bottom hand off the bat
gets across to off stump and works into midwicket
short of a length, played back to the bowler
raises the bat high out of the line
much fuller, outside off at 145kph, driven into the covers but can't find the gap
that's an excellent short ball, angles in over middle and off from round the wicket, Harris sways out of the line
full at off, defended
worked off the pads into midwicket
full at the stumps, hint of movement, he gets squared up a touch as he defends to cover
again there's a touch of extra bounce from quite a full length, takes the splice of the bat
nicely bowled, angled in at middle and off, played back up the pitch as the dot balls build for Khawaja
pushes forward to a full ball outside off, feet a little stuck, skews down to long leg
a good short ball, zips through to Pant as Khawaja was in two minds whether to play or leave
back of a length outside off, left alone
nicely bowled, short of a length and nips back, takes a thick inside half of the bat and drops down by his feet
a shorter delivery, and that's neatly played as he gets well across outside off and nudges into the square leg area
terrific ball, zips past the outside edge
starts with a short ball outside off, drops his hands and lets it go through
slips into the pads and it's neatly worked through square leg...good running makes a three
back of a length outside off, opens the face and pushes towards point
edged, but runs almost straight along the ground to second slip, Khawaja playing with reasonably soft hands as he comes forward
more seam movement as this nips back from outside off and takes him above the pad...in the box, in fact
short delivery outside off, 133kph, on his toes and defends
full outside off, a bottom-handed flick into midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone...he'll want to make him play
angles in towards off stump, behind the line and defends
outside off, just short of a length at 142kph, left alone
full outside off, 147kph, good wheels from Bumrah as Khawaja gets onto the front foot
full, wide outside off, left alone...that might be it for this spell from Bumrah. A very good five overs on a hot afternoon
that's loose! Tempted into drive at a wide delivery, saw a scoring chance, and gets beaten. Foot didn't get to the pitch
dropped! At second slip by KL Rahul. A tough chance. A shorter, wider delivery which Harris flashed at, took a top edge and went high and fast to Rahul's left
on the stumps, defended
good length outside off, defended...nervy times for Harris at the moment
gets forward and it takes a thickish outside edge along the ground towards point
defends a length ball to the covers
over the wicket, short of a length, defended to cover
fuller, outside off, and he's into a nice position to drive through the covers, the sweeper gets around
wrong line, short on the hip, flicked to long leg
some uncertainty here as he attempts to pull the bat away and it runs off the toe end into the slips
good length, angled across and climbs through to Pant above his head

edged and gone! That was on the cards, Khawaja had really struggled. A short delivery outside off, he went for the square cut, takes a top edge through to Pant. Excellent pressure from India has paid off
back of a length from round the wicket, pushed into point
full outside off, left alone
short of a length, Marsh well across on off stump, defends to point
short of a length, angled into the pads, worked to square leg
full outside off, tightly defended to the covers
gets a stride forward, bat and pad together, defended
over the wicket, angled across outside off, left alone
through to the keeper, not much carry on this one
short on leg stump, deflects off the thigh pad to long leg...ah, actually came straight off his glove
short of a length on off stump, defended
he's left this one alone and it's shaped back and taken him straight on the thigh pad...was short of a length, so no danger of lbw
short of a length and he's left this one alone, taken straight on the thigh pad
tapped square into the off side
and he's struck, this leapt at Harris! Round the wicket, just short of a length, jumps, angles back at Harris, takes the glove then loops towards slip. What a moment
full outside off, flicked to the on side, the bowler dives across
gets forward and drives down to long-off...that's far too easy for the new batsman
round the wicket, defended back to the bowler
slides on with the arm, played off the back foot to the on side
and now this bounces from back of a length and zips into Handscomb's bottom hand
positive approach, latches onto a short delivery outside off and pulls through midwicket
beats the outside edge with a full delivery, Marsh tentative outside off without much footwork
angled across outside off, left alone
that's a top shot, gets forward into a full delivery outside off and drives through covers but it doesn't quite have the legs to reach the rope
an appeal for lbw as Marsh plays across the line, but this pitched outside leg stump
beats the outside edge with one which slides on, quite wide outside off
uses his feet and drives to short cover
left alone outside off
full and driven to mid-off
wide outside off, left alone
this one spins back but was quite wide and Handscomb doesn't play
full outside off, driven nicely through the covers
short of a length outside off, left alone
worked off middle and leg, tucked to long leg
short of a length outside off, picks out point
short of a length outside off, movement away outside off, late decision to leave alone
blimey, that's a tight leave as it nips back towards off stump
round the wicket, back of a length, defended to cover
full outside off, left alone
this climbs from back of a length and is left alone through to the keeper
makes him play, back of a length outside off, defended
wider outside off, bit of a wasted delivery, left alone
better delivery, good length and shapes back towards off stump but Marsh is able to let it go through
132kph, shorter length wide of off, he punches nicely off the back foot through the vacant over region
135kph, good length, tighter to off, he's squared up a touch defending on the back foot but he knocks into the gap at cover
short ball, banged in, Marsh turns his body and his head away and cops it on the back of the right shoulder
good length, outside off, he's happy to leave this alone
136kph, good length, nipping away, he's shuffling back and across looking to defending but withdraws the hands well inside the line
139kph, good length wide of off, he leaves but it dies and falls short of Pant

caught at second slip! What a grab from Kohli! This was back of a length outside off, too close to cut but Handscomb tries, gets a thick edge that flies high to Kohli's right and he reaches up at full stretch with the right hand only and plucks it! Incredible skill from the captain.

off the glove and it flies over the cordon! Wow. This wicket is doing all sorts! This was short of a length, he goes back and it climbs up, he thrusts his gloves up, it comes off glove onto shoulder and flies over the slips
squared up defending from the crease behind point
good length angled in, he's squared up defending from the crease
beaten sparring outside off. 132kph, good length angled in and nipping away, he shuffles back and across and prods at it but it beats the bat
good length outside off, he leaves this one alone wisely
136kph, good length, off stump line, he is back and across and defending
138kph, shorter length on middle, he's back and inside the line, tucking this fine leg
136kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave
short and wide and cracked through point! This was a bad ball and Marsh pounced, he is so strong cutting and he smoked this.
good length on off stump, he's back and defending back to the bowler
138kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, angled across, he's watchfully leaving, raising the bat high
131kph into leg stump and he flicks this beautifully off the hip and the timing is amazing! Fine leg couldn't get there moving to his right
128kph, good length angled into off, he defends off the outside half of the bat to point
125kph, back of a length, off stump line, he's back and across and defending towards mid on
back of a length, fifth stump line, he's forcing off the back to mid off but can't get it wide of him
132kph, huge flash and miss attempting to cut. It was a shorter length but maybe not that wide, it just bounced a fraction and his bat was on a 45 degree angle
good length tighter to off, he's defending off the back foot to mid off
139kph, excellent length, top of off, he defends chopping this into the ground
138kph, good length across the left hander, he's leaving this alone confidently
beaten by another beauty. This was 139kph, back of a length, he fended and it climbed from a length and swung away and kept swinging high to Pant
138kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it OK and it hits the gloves hard
beats the edge again with another off cutter. 137kph, good length, well wide of off, he plays but keeps his hands inside the line as it seams away
hammers a pull shot through midwicket! He was all over this short ball. It was only chest high and he rocked back quickly and cracked it through midwicket to the fence
play and missforcing hard off the back foot. This was back of a length and wide of off and he tried to play an expansive back foot punch through cover and it zipped past the edge
fends this with soft hands, runs it along the ground wide of gully and deep backward point has to run around to cut it off
130kph, full tempter outside off and he's not tempted to play, letting this go
135kph, good length but way wide of off stump, he's not drawn to it, leaving it alone
132kph, fuller, fourth stump line, he pushes into a front foot drive, not well timed but places it wide of mid off
129kph, good length angled into middle and off and he's back and neatly working this to midwicket
good length, angled into off, he's half forward, he defends into cover
back of a length, wider of off, he leaves but it climbs through to the keeper
141kph, shorter length angled in, he's jumping back and working this awkwardly but with control behind square on the leg side
141kph, he's hit on the gloves, after making a very late decision to try and pull, got himself into a terrible position but no harm done as it drops at his feet
good length, fourth stump, he defends from the crease into the off side
another play and miss flashing outside off. 144kph, shorter length and climbing away and he plays an extravagant back foot flourish with a vertical bat and was beaten
short and wide and cracked hard to deep point
83kph, short and wide again, he's back and watching the bounce, cutting to deep point
flatter and fuller wide of off, Marsh has no interest in playing
another flatter one well wide off and again he leaves
shorter length, he punches off the back foot straight to cover
thick edge trying to cut, but it flies safely well wide of slip and races to the third man fence
good length off stump and he defends
high bouncer, he ducks under it early and it flies through to Pant
146kph, good length wide of off, he's jumping back and across, edges but along the ground to gully
143kph, very full angled into off, he works with the angle wide of fine leg and runs very aggressively, taking on the man to get two
143kph, good length angled into off, he's back and working this to the gap at midwicket
142kph, back of a length fourth stump line, he's slightly tangled defending on the back foot but covers it well enough
tossed higher and well wide of off, he leaves
pushed through wider again and he lets it go
short and wide, he jumps all over a cut shot and hammers it to deep point
pushed through on off, he defends on the front foot
nice drift, tighter to off but he's able to leave
shorter outside off he punches off the back foot to deep cover-point
back of a length, fourth stump line, he's able to leave on length
145kph, back of a length again, wide of off, this takes off and swings after it passes with Pant needing to move quickly to his left to gather
144kph, bouncer, vicious, he turned his head and ducked, again it swung after it passed and Pant knocked it down with one hand
145kph, good length, fuller, fifth stump, he leaves it alone
144kph, very full almost a yorker outside off and he jams it out
141kph, good length wide of off, he leaves it alone
tossed up 86kph, outside off and he drives back to the bowler
slightly shorter and sliding on, he's cramped pushing off the back foot to cover
tossed up outside off, he leaves this alone
shorter and cut hard to point, Shami makes a good save but he's quite deep so they get one
fuller on middle and he works with the angle to midwicket
slower on middle, he defends on the front foot
134kph, back of a length, angled into off, he defends on the back foot towards mid on
133kph, shorter on off, he's squared up completely, almost turned around defending on the back foot
133kph, full and angled into off, he whips off a thick inside edge wide of fine leg and they get two
bouncer and it takes off, he ducks, Pant jumps and reaches up with one hand to take it. Brilliant work
another bouncer, he's underneath it again but Pant can take this at head height
beaten again, angled in, nipping away, he prods on the front foot and it zips past the edge
fuller and he defends
dropped by Pant! Shorter and he tried to cut, got a faint edge and Pant can't glove it
worked off the back foot through midwicket
worked on the front foot to mid on
defended on the front foot
tossed up, he drills a drive straight back past the bowler, beautiful shot and he picks up a boundary
back of a length, outside off, he forces off the back foot through backward point to a man who is quite deep
shorter on the hip, he tucks this around the corner to fine leg
135kph, shorter ball, it climbs off a length, and he is squared up riding the bounce trying to knock it down
136kph, short and wider and he flashes hard, not in control but it flies wide of gully and away to third man
shorter ball on off, he's jumping back and defending with the full face
137kph, shorter length on middle and off, and he defends on the back foot
85kph, slower outside off, he presses forward and defends
tossed up, driven to mid on
shorter and he is back and driving off the back foot to deep cover-point
drifting into middle, he stretches out and defends
skips down and whips this nicely behind square and they run well for two.200 up for Australia
shorter and he cuts to gully
bouncer, angled down leg, he ducks underneath it
135kph, back of a length angled into off, he's back and across and defending with the full face
136kph, good length, he is back and across and defending into cover
137kph, shorter outside off, he leaves and it climbs from a length, Pant has to jump up and take it high above his head
138kph, good length, fourth stump, he leaves on line, it's tighter to off
138kph, shorter ball that has steepling bounce, he's up on his toes knocking it down
shorter outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
he skips down to a shorter length and has to prod it away with bat and pad
dances down and drives hard along the ground to long off
shorter length, he is back and working to midwicket
shorter and outside off, he forces to the gap forward of point and takes a quick one
whipped in the air wide of mid on into the gap and it runs away to the rope! That was a brave shot, down the track against the turn and in the air but he found the gap
good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot to cover
133kph, good length, fifth stump line, wide of off, he leaves alone
130kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave alone
131kph, attempts an expansive drive wide of off, drags a thick inside edge that runs past leg stump down to fine leg
drives in the air off a thick edge through backward point, Jadeja is on as sub and he races around from deep point
129kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
short outside off, he steps back and drives to deep cover
uses his feet and drives down to long-off
kicks this one away outside off, there's an appeal for lbw but not much interest
presses forward and defends a length delivery
goes back in the crease and whips this into midwicket
leans forward, this slides on with the arm takes an inside edge to the leg side
full outside off, some late swing away, left alone
through to the keeper again at 135kph
gets nicely forward into a fuller delivery and drives to cover
gets across to off stump then leaves it alone
full at off stump, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, he doesn't play...a little lull ahead of the new ball?
cut to backward point
defended into the covers
defended
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
just a hint of width, he rocks back and cuts it find of point
aims to repeat the cut shot and is beaten this time, Pant gloves it but no edge
round the wicket, full at the stumps, defended
dragged down short and superbly whipped through straight midwicket, terrific timing and placement
short outside off, cut to the cover sweeper
waits for this, opens the face and finds backward point
just gets away with this as he comes down the pitch and miscues short of mid-on, was aiming to go over the top, bat twisted in his hand
that's how to us your feet! Takes a skip down the pitch and unfurls the perfect on-drive. Lovely stuff
leans forward and drives, beats cover out to the sweeper
defended back down the pitch
touch shorter, tapped square into the off side
low full toss which he clips towards mid-on
punched into the off side, cover dives but can't cut it off - it's the captain
what a catch! Oh boy, that's a snaffle and Vihari has nabbed a second. Marsh went for cut, the ball flew off the top edge and Rahane took a superb catch at slip. That was travelling
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, gets completely squared up as he plays to the covers
squared up again by some late seam movement, although he was trying to take a delivery from outside off into the leg side
short of a length outside off, steered with an open face through backward point
short of a length, a neat back-foot punch into the covers
round the wicket, across onto off stump to get inside the line, tucks it off his hip towards backward square where a misfield by Umesh makes the second comfortable
fuller outside off, pushed into the covers and that's his fifty, another good innings, he's counterattacked smartly
driven to deep cover
good length outside off, defended
short outside off, goes for the cut but picks out backward point
back on a good length, defended
short outside off, will feel he's missed out again as he square drives to point
and for a third time this over he can't find the gap against a short ball
back of a length outside off, he goes for the pull and it goes straight back down the pitch, Shami gets his left hand on it, parries the ball past mid-on
full outside off, left alone
this nips back, short of a length, worked to the leg side
short outside off, square drives into the covers without much timing
played to the leg side
throws his hands through another attacking shot, a delivery wide outside off, skews away wide of gully
good length at off stump, defended
short of a length, worked into the leg side
full toss, wide outside off, Paine doesn't miss out this time and drives through the covers
left alone outside off
short outside off, drags his pull straight of midwicket down to long-on...not far from picking out the fielder
works a short delivery off his pads to deep square...new ball, surely?
beaten straightaway as he aims to drive off the back foot, extra bounce with the new nut
full outside off, this zips through to Pant at 137kph
full, wide outside off, driven to mid-off, almost threw himself off his feet
back of a length outside off, angles the face and runs it wide of gully
full and straight, worked to mid-on
that's a good one, full outside off with some late swing, Paine comes forward and is beaten

caught at third man! Not a conventional new ball wicket...full, very wide outside off, Head throws the kitchen sink into another drive, flies straight to the fielder who barely had to move. They check the no-ball and it's fine
over the wicket, good length outside off, swings back in to Cummins who defends
full outside off, again it shapes back, wide enough to leave
keeps it full outside off, defended on the front foot
tightly defended back down the pitch
back of a length outside off, watches it go through
good length outside off, significant shape back at Paine who leaves alone
that's a rare poor delivery, a wide full toss, but Paine can only drive to point
what a beauty as this straightens off the seam and climbs past the shoulder of Paine's bat
that's even better, unplayable as Bumrah gets it fuller, it shoots from a good length, Paine is aiming through the leg side, beaten comprehensively and it climbs over Pant
a touch shorter outside off, 146kph, defends down towards gully
works a straight delivery behind square on the leg side and scampers a second
good length outside off, left alone
drives and gets beaten as he plays an attacking stroke
back of a length at off stump, manages to ankle it through backward point
cuts towards point, let through for a single
full at off stump, driven square into the off side
fantastic shot from the captain as he latches onto a pull shot and sends it racing over square leg
beaten by another beauty as he angles it in at off stump on a full length and it moves away late
full and straight, flicked down to long leg
full at off stump, 143kph, defended to mid-on
tucks a straight delivery wide of mid-on
a very short bounce outside off, easily left alone
goes for the yorker, big appeal for lbw but that appears to be slipping down the leg side
left alone outside off
short of a length, runs off an open face into backward point
short of a length at middle and off, defended on the back foot
comes forward into a full delivery, pushes to mid-off
lets this through outside off
across onto off stump to a back-of-a-length delivery, defends towards cover
back of a length, defended off the splice to cover
full at the stumps, defended towards point
a short ball outside off, balloons through to Pant who makes another leaping take
full and straight, very nice piece of timing as he works it wide of mid-on which gives Ishant a chase and a throw. Not the most powerful return
gets forward and drives to point
a short ball, straight, he goes for the pull and it falls short of the man at deep square
good length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, played into the off side
short of a length outside off, driven square to backward point
defended back down the pitch
gets very nicely forward into a full delivery, drives into the covers
another flying take from Pant, one-handed grab as this very short bouncer flies through
takes an inside edge into the leg side, where short leg could have been
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, defended to cover
beats the outside edge with one that skims through, perhaps a fraction short if critical
short of a length, defended to the off side
a big full toss slips out, Cummins manages to push it towards mid-on
a bouncer, 140kph, he ducks
big appeal for lbw off the last ball of the day, but Bumrah suggests Cummins has nicked it...looked pretty good. No review. Ah, yes, comes off the toe end. Not much bounce, interesting pitch!
133kph, good length, fifth stump line, it zips away, he leaves well and it flies through to Pant
134kph, back of a length wide of off, inswinger coming back, he leaves on length
136kph, shorter length down leg and he opts not to try and glance, keeps his hands inside the line
131kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he leaves it alone again watchfully
fuller length, hint of shape away, he drives without a great deal of footwork straight to wide mid off
134kph, shorter length, on off, he's back and across and working to the gap at midwicket
136kph, good length pitching fifth stump line and angling further in but he can leave on length and line
133kph, wider line, good length again, some shape back but Paine is happy to watch it go by
big inswinger, full, he steps a long way across, it misses the pad and just misses leg stump! Leg stump was exposed there
back of a length fourth stump, he cuts getting on top of the bounce well out to a deep backward point in place
beaten by a nice delivery. Good length wide of off, look to shape in, he went to defend and it nipped away off the seam, missed the edge by a long way
fuller inswinger but wide of off, he is happy to leave this alone
pulls hard gets a top edge but there's no deep square and it rolls to the rope! This did bounce a little more than expected, he tried to roll the wrists but got the top edge but he got enough of it
fuller length, wide of off, he's happy to leave on the front foot
shorter wide of off, he cuts with control down to a square third man
135kph, back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot to mid on
134kph, good length, wide of off, it wobbled a bit but he is able to leave
nearly plays on trying to leave. It was a good length, wide of off, but he was late to withdraw the bat, it bounced a little and hit the bat as he left it, ricocheted down onto pad and away
130kph, inswinger, full on off, he gets thick inside edge through the gap at midwicket
130kph, shorter length down leg, he leg glances but misses
134kph, good length inswinger, he presses forward to defend, gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
135kph, good length, fourth stump, he's back and across and defending to cover

run out chance but Rahul can't gather! He defends tight in the off side, Paine calls early but Cummins is slow to go, Rahul swoops from mid off but doesn't gather! If he did and fired, Cummins was in trouble
good length wide of off, he is happy to leave
132kph, bouncer, he was going to hook and bailed out and ended up falling onto his back! Good move to bail out. Great bouncer
134kph, good length, fifth stump line, nipping away, he doesn't have any interest in playing
134kph, fourth stump line, good length, he's back and squared up a little bit but defends fine to cover
133kph, short bouncer wide of off, he shapes to pull but wisely bails out and drops the hands underneath it
stays lower and hits the thigh as he's trying to pull again. This was a shorter length, probably not that short but it does stay a touch lower and hits the back hip as he swivelled around
cracking cut shot backward of point! Short and wide and he got up on his toes and played with great control past point. It made a superb sound off the blade and raced to the rope
132kph, short into the ribs, he's inside the line and working this well to fine leg
134kph, fuller on off, he is squared up pushing on the front foot to mid off
133kph, high bouncer, he ducks as it flies through to the keeper
135kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
136kph, good length into middle and leg, he's working this with the angle to mid on
134kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot off the sticker of the bat back to the bowler
134kph, fuller length, excellent length, fifth stump line, he lets this go and it swings after passing the batsman
136kph, shorter length, well wide of off and he leaves it alone
132kph, shorter length, hits the thigh pad and rolls away and Paine races through with a smart call
133kph, short ball, pulled forward of square, not well struck but he'll get a couple as the man is well behind square in the deep
135kph, another bouncer, he hooks again awkwardly, not in control off the gloves and flies fine of fine leg, nowhere near the fielder
134kph, good length, fourth stump line, he leaves as it flies through to Pant
131kph, very full into leg stump, he works towards mid on on the front foot
big inswinger, good length, it zips in and takes the thigh pad and rolls square, they get an easy leg bye
LBW appeal but not out. Way too high. No review. This was a good length, nipping in, it hit above the pad and was going over. Better delivery
132kph, shorter ball sprayed down the leg side and he lets it go
136kph, half-volley on leg stump, clipped neatly off the pads, nicely timed out to the man at deep forward square
133kph back of a length, swinging to the thigh pad, it runs away close on the leg side
133kph, back of a length outswinger wide of off and he lets this go
shorter and way wide of off, he's happy to withdraw the bat behind him
good length fifth stump line, he leaves out of the hand
fourth stump line, good length, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid off
134kph, shorter length outside off, he punches off the back foot into the gap at cover and they take on Rahul but's it's well place. Easy one in the end
135kph, outswinger, well wide of off, he's happy to sit back and watch it pass
wide of the crease, good length, well wide of off, he is happy to leave this alone
beaten by a superb leg cutter. Wide of the crease angled in, hits the seam and nips away as he is squared up on the crease
138kph, beaten again sparring at a shorter one away from his body outside off
140kph, good length, he defends with soft hands on the crease, Paine calls him through, great running. 300 is up. Warm applause from the Australian fans
139kph, shorter length angled into off, he's defending awkwardly on the back foot

play and miss again sparring wide of off. This was fuller, angled in and zipping away off the seam, he was deep in the crease, and just pushed the hands at it but it was beating the edge by some margin
136kph, good length onto leg stump, he clips to midwicket
133kph, angled into leg stump he works this neatly with the angle through the gap at midwicket. 50 partnership up for this pair
again angled into the top of the pad, there's an appeal for LBW but this isn't close as it's going down, Paine calls Cummins through for a leg bye
138kph, good length on off, he's squared up a touch defending on the front foot
just short of second slip! This climbed off a length, he tried to get the bat out of the way but it runs off the face, but down short of Kohli
good length outside off, he defends on the front foot
135kph, shorter outside off, he's up on his toes running this off an open face to the man at wide third man
140kph, another play and miss! This zipped and climbed outside off, he tried to punch off the back foot, but it flew past the edge
fuller outside off, he's forward and pushing firmly to wide mid off
141kph, shorter length, nipping in and beats the inside edge, taking him on the thigh
142kph, short ball, he tries to pull, miscues completely and just pops it up close on the off side but safely for a single
141kph, good length fourth stump line, he plays a rock solid defensive stroke
138kph, play and missdriving on the up outside off. Good length swinging away. That shot wasn't on to that length
134kph, back of a length, nipping into the thigh guard
141kph, shorter length on off, gets big on him, he takes his bottom hand off the bat and knocks it down off the sticker of the bat
136kph, good length, he's back and across and defending into the off side
135kph, shorter length but quite close to Paine, he leans back and cuts just past backward point and wide third man comes around
138kph, fuller length on middle, he's trying to work to leg, but gets a slight leading edge that bounces back to the bowler
good length at off stump, worked to short leg which has just come in place
back of a length outside off, defended to point
left alone outside off
a short ball outside off, he aborts his pull and lets it through
ouch! Short of a length, hammers into Paine's ribs and bobbles to the leg side
full toss on off stump and that's put away, driven straight of mid-on...taking advantage of the poor delivery
131kph, wide outside off, left alone
that's a good one! In the channel on off stump, straightens off the seam to beat the edge
full and straight, defended
a short ball over middle and leg, he ducks
defended into the off side from a good length
that's cleaned him up! It's a ripping delivery, and the key was it was pitched in the full area. Angled in at off stump, just straightens off the seam, beats the outside edge and smashes off stump
full outside off, pushed towards point

and another one! Back-to-back strikes for India, Paine trapped in front as he goes well back in his crease to quite a full delivery although he has called for the review. Well, it's shading towards leg stump...and it's smashing leg stump
and he's off the mark first ball with a strong clip off the pads through midwicket
round the wicket, good length, played back to the bowler
played from off stump to mid-on
goes for the yorker, comes out as a full toss and is clipped wide of mid-on
beaten by an unplayable delivery! On a good length at off stump, beats and climbs past the edge
a straight length delivery, flicked in the air through midwicket
gets forward and times a defensive push very nicely straight of mid-off
a bouncer outside off, Pant has to leap in the air to gather it
short of a length and now he brings out the short-arm jab/pull through square leg
good length at the stumps, bunted to the gap at midwicket
round the wicket, wide outside off, left alone
goes for the big shot, fetches this from full outside off and launches in the air over wide mid-on, didn't quite come out of the middle
another neat flick into the leg side as he takes a straight delivery wide of mid-on
short of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, Starc spars away from his body and is beaten
slightly closer to off stump but again too short, left alone
starts a little too straight and is flicked away fine, but the fielder is able to get across

edged, and taken by Pant Starc goes down swinging. A full and wide delivery from round the wicket, Starc shapes for a big drive and gets an outside edge to the keeper who moves to take it in front of first slip
edged, gone first ball! A full delivery, angled in at off stump, Hazlewood is forced to play and it's a sharp grab from Pant as he springs to his left
pushed across outside off, Rahul holds the bat inside the line
flung wider outside off, 141kph, left alone
gets this full at the stumps, 140kph, defended to mid-off
this one doesn't shape back, holds its line as Starc pushes it across on a full length, Rahul playing away from his body and is beaten
short of a length, just outside off at 141kph, shaping back and left alone as much on length as line...Paine takes it at head height
fuller, wider outside off, some swing back and it's left alone
starts on the pads, deflected away fine and long leg can't get across...no bat involved
down the leg side again, zips through to Paine...the radar not quite right yet
back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
this beats the outside edge as it straightens off the seam, just short of a good length
this is a touch fuller, at the stumps, played into the leg side
this is a good one, full outside off, that's the spot and it beats the outside edge as Vijay presses forward
full and straight, some late swing, clipped to fine leg...Starc got excited for a second
wide outside off, 142kph, left alone
short, wide, left alone...and he's overstepped
short of a length at middle and off, 141kph, defended to backward point
he nearly has a fiddle at this as it angles across outside off, back of a length, but pulls the bat out of the line
angled down the leg side, clips the pad on its way to Paine

cleans him up! That's trademark Starc. Full, swinging back into the right hander, he goes for the drive, leaves a big gate and the ball smashes into the stumps. Ideal length, poor shot so close to lunch
good length, outswinger fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
141kph, perfect length, off stump line, he gets an inside edge defending onto pad
141kph, full into leg stump, hits the pad as he tries to whip through square
142kph, bouncer wide of off, he ducks underneath it as it flies through
142kph, fuller length well wide of off, he leaves this alone
138kph, back of a length outside off, he leaves and it flies through to the keeper
full inswinger, outside off, he defends on the front foot
140kph, full and angled across, not much shape back, he's happy to leave
139kph, shorter length swinging into the hip, he tucks this neatly wide of fine leg
144kph, good length angled across, no swing, he leaves out of the hand
143kph, back of a length, shaping back, he leaves on length and it flies through to Paine
swinging into leg stump, he glances this nicely down to fine leg.

bowled him! Brilliant yorker! This was amazing. It was wobbling the whole way down, threatened to come in and then dipped a little under the groping bat and it splayed middle and off stump back! KL Rahul cops a brute and Australia are on fire!
146kph, perfect length, off stump, he's in to line early and defending on the front foot
Checked on drive! Wow! This is some stroke from the king. Slightly overpitched he leaned on it, and timed it perfectly between the stumps and mid on
141kph, shorter outside off, he's riding the bounce with soft hands running it late between third slip and gully for two. Beautifully played
140kph, back of a length, outside off, he leaves on length and it flies through
140kph, back of a length, climbing, but he's up on his toes pushing off the back foot to point
141kph, full and sprayed way wide of off, he shows no interest in playing
141kph, he oversteps, good length outside off and left alone
full and angled way wide of off, he leaves again
147kph, rocket, good length angled across, fourth stump line, he defends with the bat deliberately well inside the line
145kph, swinging down the leg side, no way he can catch up with it
141kph, short bouncer, outside off, Pujara sees it early and sways underneath
143kph, full swinging into the pads and he glances this off the front foot down to fine leg
139kph, good length angled in to middle, straightening, he's squared up and hit on the back thigh
142kph, good length outswinger, wide of off, he leaves out of the hand
edged and just short of first slip! Another cracker 142kph angled in to middle straightening, he's squared up, genuine edge defending and it drops a foot short of Marsh at first slip.
141kph, good length, fuller, on off, he's half forward defending on the front foot
141kph, angled into leg stump, he clips this through midwicket nicely, waited for it and worked into the vacant area on the leg side
145kph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves on the back foot with the bat raised
143kph, good length, shaping in, he defends with soft hands on the front foot, knocking it down onto his front shin
142kph, beaten by another beauty. This was full but didn't swing back, it angled across and flew past the edge at high speed on the front foot and the keeper took it above his head
lovely cover drive! This was full and wide and he reached out and bravely placed it with beautiful hands through the gap at cover and timed it well enough to get to the rope
142kph, beaten again defending at a good length. It didn't swing, hit the seam and went with the angle past the edge. Credit to Pujara, he didn't follow with the hands

appeal for caught down leg but not out. No review. 145kph, shorter swinging into the hip, it just missed the gloves and flicked his shirt through to Paine. The keeper went up but didn't get much support from the bowler
swinging into the pads and he picks this off, clipping behind square wide of fine leg
