straighter line, he gets onto the front foot and works around his pad to midwicket
he's back to a ball that spins, and gets a thick inside edge past short leg
88kph, good length outside off, he stretches out, it spins and bounces, takes the glove but drops down safe
135kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and pushing into the off side
good length, seventh stump line, he is happy to leave on the front foot
good length, he pushes on the front foot, gets a thick inside edge that runs through forward square, Harris runs from deep square to gather but falls over humorously
back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defends
140kph, good length outside off, he fends away from his body with soft hands and it runs along the ground past gully to third man
140kph, bouncer, he spots it early and ducks underneath
beautiful off break, pitching near the footmark, he stretches out and defends from a length
fuller and quicker, 88kph, he drives firmly to long on
shorter, he's back and working to square leg and they run a tight one with Cummins running to his left
87kph, good length, he's back and covering up in defence
slower on off, he works on the front foot to short leg
89kph, tossed up outside off, he defends on the front foot into the off side
shorter length, he's back and across and defending into midwicket
139kph, back of a length, he's back and defending close into the off side and they run a brilliant single
139kph, high bouncer, he ducks under it early
magnificent drive straight of mid off! This was overpitched and he played a lovely flowing drive with the full face. Glorious stroke
high bouncer, he ducks underneath it easily
138kph, vicious short ball, he rides it, thrusting his gloves up, and knocking it down. He didn't know much about that one
tossed up wide of off, he defends on the front foot to point
tossed up outside off, he drives firmly back to the bowler
slaps a drive against the spin straight of cover! Wonderful shot. Tremendous skill. He was too full and he thumped this through the gap and it raced away
a leading edge, trying to turn to leg, it falls safe on the off side

run out chance but no direct hit! Another leading edge into point, Kohli calls, Vihari is late to go, Head swoops from backward point gathers and throws and just misses, Vihari was well short, Paine couldn't collect the awkward half volley. If he'd taken it cleanly it still might have been out
straighter line, he defends on the front foot
full and a hint of swing in, he drives off a thick inside half through midwicket and he runs really well to get two as deep square comes around

straight drive! Magnificent stroke to bring up an all-time century! Just overpitched, he leaned into it and just pushed it straight of mid off and it raced away. What a sensational knock. It's a subdued celebration. More work to do
full and wide and he flashes and misses trying to square drive
good length, across him, he leaves this alone
144kph, good length, across him, he leaves this alone again
good length, angled across, he defends with soft hands off the edge and it rolls to gully
good length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending into the off side
inswinger into leg stump, he works this nicely behind square, well timed wide of fine leg
136kph, beaten by a nice leg cutter, fifth stump line, he prods from the crease and misses
136kph, good length outside off, he leaves this alone wide of off
135kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending with the full face
135kph, good length wide of off, he's happy to watch this go through to Paine
141kph, shorter length well wide of off, he leaves this alone
145kph, good length, angled across and he leaves this alone again well wide of off
lovely cover drive! Overpitched again and he caresses this down on knee through the gap at cover and the timing is spectacular
142kph, bouncer, this flies, Paine jumps very high and just knocks it down
146kph, fuller length outside off, he drives but drags it to midwicket off the inside half
150kph, fuller on off, he defends back to the bowler
135kph, good length outside off, he plays an easy check drive to mid off
137kph, good length fifth stump line, he leaves this alone
136kph, wide of the crease, fuller length, he presses forward and plays a textbook forward defence

slashes a cut off the top edge over third man! There's no one back, it was short and wide and it bounced, he thrashed at it so hard, tried to go up and slashed it high over third man and it carried all the way
beaten by a beauty! Good length, fifth stump line, he pushed to defend and it nipped past the edge
good length, wider of off, he leaves this alone
145kph, shorter length on off, he's back and knocking this away through forward square and the man is back
142kph, fuller outside off, he reaches out on the drive but drags it back to the bowler
146kph, shorter ball, it climbs, he fends this away off the back foot, it catches the shoulder and goes in the air a little way but nowhere near point
lovely late cut, this climbed at speed, he got on top of the bounce and ran it past gully to wide third man
back of a length on off, he defends from the crease deep in the crease, looked for one close on the leg side but opts not to
148kph, full on leg stump, he clips this behind square to deep backward square
135kph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves this alone and Paine takes it above his head
135kph, back of a length outside off, he defends away from his body into the off side

caught behind! Perfect delivery outside off, great length, he's caught on the crease, it hits the seam, nips away, he tries to defend with limited footwork and gets a thin edge through to the keeper. Easy catch for Paine
140kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and defending away from his body to cover
136kph, shorter length, he's up on his toes defending down onto the pitch
good length, outside off, he defends on the front foot off a thick edge to backward point
139kph, shorter outside off, he gets up on his toes and pushes with a horizontal bat to the man at deep point
bouncer 144kph, it took off like a flying saucer and went way over Paine's head and flew to the rope
146kph, back of a length, he is back and across and defending into the off side
147kph, very full angled down leg, it runs off the inside edge onto pad down to fine leg
short on off, he's back and defending off a thick inside edge close on the leg side and Pant's races through for one
beaten by 147kph, good length ball that threatened to angle in but held it's line. He tried to defend on the front foot but it zipped past the edge
shorter outside off, he's back and defending to point and taking one as the man is well back to allow one
138kph, good length angled across, he defends from the crease to mid off
135kph, good length, tighter to off stump, he defends on the front foot
137kph, good length across him, he's back and across and defending to point
136kph, into the hip, he works this away through forward square to the man in the deep, they push for two but it's not on
137kph, high bouncer well down leg, he swivels to pull but can't connect as it flies to Paine
144kph, beaten again trying to defend from the crease, it just held it's line outside off
145kph, angled down leg, he flicks in the air for awhile but short of fine leg
145kph, perfect length, nearly squeezes through, gets a thin inside edge onto the back thigh
142kph, fuller outside off, he presses forward decisively and pushed to the gap at cover-point
145kph, fuller angled into off and he clips this with the angle wide of mid on, nice shot, well timed
147kph, short one, climbs off the shoulder of the bat in the air but it falls just short of point! That was a brutish delivery
141kph, fuller outside off he pushes on the front foot wide of mid off
138kph, half-volley, he drives beautifully but Finch makes an outstanding diving stop at cover
137kph, sixth stump line, good length, he defends on the front foot
139kph, good length outside off, he pushes on the front foot into the big gap at cover-point
edges driving but along the ground fine of gully and runs to third man! It was full, he pushed at it but the edge went along the ground, he didn't push too hard and got rewarded for playing later
bouncer, at the body, but he ducks under early and lets it fly over the head
131kph, shorter length, outside off, he's back sharply and knocking this to the gap at cover-point
135kph, fuller outside off, he reaches out to drive but gets a thick inside edge that runs to the gap at square leg
136kph, angled well down leg, he tries to glance but it's too far away from his hip
136kph, good length nipping in beating the inside edge and hitting the back thigh
135kph, good length on off, he's back and squared up a touch defending to point
138kph, back of a length outside off, he pushes off the back foot with control into the gap at backward point
tossed up outside off, he stretches out and defends on the front foot
tossed wider and he plays a glorious cover drive! That is sumptuous. Too full and wide but the skill to hammer this in the gap against the turn is something else
shorter and flatter, he's back and defending
slightly fuller, he is back again watching it turn into the middle of his bat as he defends
tossed up wide again, he drives hard but mistimes this to mid off, and it frustrated he didn't pick the gap
flatter outside off, he stretches out and defends on the front foot
shorter length on off, he's back and across and defending into the off side
edges a drive along the ground between second slip and gully to the third man now in place
135kph, good length well wide of off and he lets this go
135kph, good length, outside off, he's happy to raise the bat and let it pass again
136kph, good length, seventh stump line, he watchfully leaves again

caught at second slip is it? They check it with the third umpire. Full outside off, he drives hard, gets a thick edge that flies low to second slip, Handscomb diving low to his right has taken it but it's hard to tell whether he got his fingers underneath or it half-volleyed in. The soft signal is out. Nigel Llong needs conclusive evidence to turn it over. It's out! That was so tight. It was hard to tell and Nigel Llong couldn't overturn on what he saw.
short and wide, he's back and cutting hard to deep point
caught behind! What a delivery! This drifted away, pitched, spun and bounced, it just catches a thin outside edge as Shami pushes forward, Paine rises and takes an excellent catch!
full at off stump, Ishant strides forward and blocks
fuller, he drives to mid-off
this one turns from outside off, defended down in front of silly point
beats the edge with one that goes on with the arm, Paine can't glove it cleanly. No nick
short of a length outside off, drives behind point to the sweeper...happy to take the single, after a little uncertainty
back of a length at off stump, pushed towards point and sets off for the single but is sent back
a shorter ball, he hops behind the line and defends down by his feet
he butts this one away, turning away from a short-of-a-length delivery and hits him straight on the buttock
fuller, at the stumps, 137kph, pushed back down the pitch
short, at the body, fended behind square and they take the single on offer
full outside off, encourages the drive, runs to mid-on
return catch, Lyon has another! Not a clever shot from Ishant, trying to drive out of the footmarks, the bat twists in his hand and provides a relatively simple chance to Lyon's left
full outside off, leans forward and pushes back to the bowler
gets across the stumps and flicks into midwicket
tapped down in front of short leg
full and straight, nudged to the leg side so Umesh does his job there
dropped, that was smashed back at Cummins! A length delivery, Pant crunched it back down the pitch and Cummins couldn't hold it at shin height
sprayed very wide outside off, not far off being called, Paine takes in front of first slip
full outside off, presses forward and plays out to deep point...he was looking for a second, but slipped as he turned. Not sure there was two anyway
plays this well, short of a length, works it past short leg
short of a length outside off, has a slash and is beaten over the top edge
short outside off, he shapes to pull to the leg side but is through the shot and it bobbles towards mid-off. Can't get the strike
beats the edge and it bounces through to Paine, taken at shoulder height on the rise
prods forward and defends
gets forward and plays this firmly towards silly point
touch more air on this one, he goes for a sweep and gets an under-edge towards short fine leg
round the wicket, works a length delivery into midwicket
full outside off, defended on the front foot
has a huge swing outside off, width from Cummins, doesn't make contact
angled across well outside off, left alone
very wide outside off, through to the keeper...game of cat and mouse
goes after this one, carved over backward point towards the sweeper...a poor return from Finch in the deep helps them make the second
square drives and misses outside off, almost swings himself over
full, wide outside off, Pant tries to reach out for it but can't make contact so Umesh will have the strike
plays back and punches to the off side
plays forward and gets beaten, more troublesome bounce from Lyon
stretches forward and pushes to mid-off
tossed wider outside off, Umesh attempts a slog-sweep, there's an appeal for a catch behind, but only Paine interested really
being teased by a wide line outside off, plays well away from his body and is beaten by the drift
gets bat on this one, blocks it back down the pitch
full, wide outside off, flayed out to deep point and he takes the single...Pant's inexperience showing here when it comes to batting with the tail?
round the wicket, short outside off, climbs past the bat as Umesh pushes away from his body
goes fuller, at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
short of a length outside off, jabbed towards point
shorter, at the body, Umesh gets behind the line and defends to the on side
goes for the yorker! Umesh does very well to keep it out off the toe end
there's a big one from Pant! Round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, he clubs it over midwicket and wide of the fielder in the deep
flatter, shorter, outside off and pushed back to the bowler
that's a huge one! Onto the second tier, I think. Lovely footwork and launched it straight down the ground
pushes a length ball to the off side, looks for the single but it's not there
tossed wide outside off, spins away further, left alone
leaves this alone outside off, looks annoyed with himself
short at off stump, turns his head away and jabs it away off the splice
just wide of short leg, a well-directed short ball at the body, Umesh fends at it and out of reach of Finch
beats him outside off, 147kph, as Pant comes forward looking for the drive...Starc cranking it up
back of a length outside off, room to free his arms, carves it through the covers and wide enough of the sweeper for a second
full outside off, 150kph, dug out down the ground to long-on
fantastic yorker! But Umesh does very well to get the bat down on it. Good stuff from the No. 10
clubs a delivery from outside off, one bounce to long-on
forward and blocks
beats the edge with one that slides on
this is a quicker delivery outside off, 100kph, and almost swerves past the edge
stretches forward and defends
defends this down off the splice in front of silly point
146kph, full outside off, has a huge swing across the line aiming for deep midwicket
full toss outside off, 150kph, flicked along the ground to long-on...frustrated with his placement
short at the body, gets inside the line and neatly flicks this down to long leg
that's a beauty, back of a length length outside off, zips past the edge
full at the stumps, flicked off the pads to deep square
over the wicket, on the pads, flicked away and well fielded at leg gully
finds long-on! So Lyon wins the battle. Full outside off, Pant tried to clear the leg side but couldn't get the distance. A very good, low catch by Starc in the deep
beaten by turn and bounce, plays inside the line
feels well away from his body at this one, doesn't make contact
and he's clubbed it straight down the ground! That's almost four times his average in one stroke. A full delivery on the stumps, crashed straight back over Lyon
and Lyon's got him this time, five wickets for offie! Full delivery outside off, again it's the one that goes straight on, takes the outside edge and a beat catch at slip
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed towards the covers to get off the mark...stand down on the hat-trick
good length outside off, 127kph, left alone
some late swing in at Finch, comes forward and pushes towards mid-on
beats the outside edge with a good-length delivery which starts to swing in, forces the shot, then holds its line
big inswing on this one, Finch shoulders arms and gets whacked on the stomach
fuller, outside off, another inswinger which he forces into midwicket off the front foot. Testing opening over
round the wicket, good length at off stump, defended
133kph, outside off, left alone
a shorter delivery, he goes onto the back foot and defends
fuller, outside off, and significant movement away, keeps going on the way to Pant who can't glove it cleanly
shorter, outside off, left alone
that's a ripper which angles in towards off stump then straightens to beat the outside edge
133kph, good length inswinger, he's defending trying to push onto the front foot
136kph, good length shaping back in again, he pushes firmly with the full face to mid on
beaten prodding forward! This was 133kph, it looked to shape in but hit the seam and held it's line and went past the edge to much excitement from the Indians
133kph, drives on the up through cover-point. Positive stroke, it was a good length but he pushed through the line and found the gap
edged and it flies between slips and gully and away! He pushed hard and got a thick edge that went through fourth slip, Kohli dives from third but it's well wide of him and away it goes to the rope

appeal for caught behind, India are convinced, not out is the call. And they do not review! It was brilliant ball, angled in nipping away, squared him up completely but it missed the edge and clipped the back pad through to Pant. Great decision. It hit outside the line too. Amazing delivery
beaten by a cracker! This is an incredible delivery. Around the wicket, angled in it hit the seam and took off, miles past the edge and Pant had to climb high to take it
145kph, good length angled into off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
back of a length, angled into off, he defends on the back foot very solidly
beats the edge again! 144kph, good length, angled in, nipping away, he presses forward to defend and it blows by the edge at high speed.
142kph, shorter length, he's back and across and defending covering off stump
145kph, yorker length into off stump, he jams down and squeezes it out pretty comfortably to backward point
good length, 135kph, he presses forward, gets a thick inside edge that runs outside the pad and down to fine leg
130kph, angled down leg but it straightens, he turns the face and gets a leading edge along the ground to backward point

edged and dropped at first slip! Another brilliant delivery, angled in, hits the seam, squares him up, gets a edge, fine of first slip who is wide, Pujara dives low to his right and with one hand puts it down. They get a run on the drop
inswinger, he gets a thick inside edge behind square and he pushes really hard to get two
131kph, huge inswinger, he's forward and falling over as it hoops back in and bounces to hit the back thigh very high
134kph, inswinger, perfect length, gets a thick inside edge prodding at it and it runs to midwicket
141kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he can leave on length
full, on off, he jams down and slices it into the gully
145kph, very full outside off, he squeezes a drive out to point
140kph, back of a length wide of off, he's happy to leave again
142kph, good length, angled into off, he defends with soft hands and it runs behind point for a couple
144kph, back of a length, off stump line, he defends into cover
good length way wide of off, he's happy to leave alone
136kph, good length, angled into off, he defends pressing forward to point
139kph, good length fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
beaten. Strange shot. 134kph, good length, wide of off, he pressed forward, no need to play on length and it just zips past the prodding blade
nearly caught down the leg side! It was short down leg, he tried to pull, gloved it and Pant flying like superman can't reach it! He was close but no one could catch that. It flies to the rope
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends solidly on the front foot back to the bowler
good length, fifth stump line, he's happy to leave this alone
145kph, good length angled into off, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid on
shorter length into middle, he defends off the back foot to midwicket
145kph, good length fired into middle stump and he defends with the full face on the front foot

he gets hit flush on the badge of the helmet! He's knocked over backwards. He's OK. he's bounced back up. What a brute of a ball. Short, lifting, it following him, he ducked late and it hit the helmet flush. It ricocheted away to point
141kph, good length, sixth stump line, he's happy to leave this alone
133kph, good length, fourth stump line he defends on the front foot
134kph, back of a length, wider of off, he finally lets one go
cracking square drive on the up! This wasn't a half volley, 134kph, but he seized on the width and hammered it through point. Super shot
pulled behind square! Picked the short length quickly and swivelled, he rolled the wrists to stay on top of it despite taking his eye of it a touch but he still cracked it behind square leg
135kph, good length, beaten prodding again outside off, it hit the seam and zipped away
138kph, shorter length, he's still pushing forward and defending off the sticker back to the bowler
140kph beats him again, this pitched on middle and nipped across him, he pushed forward and it swerved past the edge
144kph, good length, on off stump, he defends on the front foot to mid off
145kph, fuller, outside off, he drives to mid off who is very close
141kph, good length, middle and off, he pushes firmly back to the bowler on the front foot
144kph, low full toss, he pushes this through the gap at cover and gets off strike

drives on the up through cover! This was brave. 140kph, wide and not a half-volley, he reaches out well away from his body and flows his hands through the line, picking the gap at cover and it races away
short into the hip, he's back and tucking this behind square neatly
136kph, shorter length on leg, he shuffles across and is hit on the thigh guard, there's an appeal but it's not out, high and going down, it rolls away for an extra
139kph, good length, middle stump line, he defends on the front to mid on
138kph, shorter ball, he's back and pulling hard but straight to the man at forward square
135kph, back of a length, off stump line, he defends off the back foot to mid off
139kph, he defends to cover-point, Harris initially calls 'No' but changes his mind and calls 'yes', there is an easy one as he found the gap
137kph, beats him again! Wow. Shorter length, pitching leg stump, it climbed up and across him as he tried to defend, it flew to Pant
137kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease towards mid off
good length, across the left hander, he lets this go
142kph, gets a bottom edge that rolls to second. It was a good length outside off, he prodded at it and runs off the bottom of the bat to Rahul
143kph, into middle stump, he slices across a front foot push and gets a thick edge towards point
good length, into middle and leg, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid on
139kph, short ball and hits him on the bottom hand, flush on his right index finger, he knocks it down
gets a short ball straightaway from round the wicket, has to be alert to get underneath
full outside off, he crabs across the crease and defends to point
has a fiddle outside off to a short-of-a-length delivery which seams away, playing a long way from his body without any footwork
gets across to off stump, more solidly behind the line, defended
well bowled again, more bounce and seam movement, short of a length and jabbed to the off side...a fraction fuller, perhaps?
short of a length on middle and leg, tucked off his hip behind square
defended to the off side
fuller at off stump, nicely forward into a solid push straight of mid-off
a flashing square drive! Lovely-looking shot from Harris, he leans back on the drive, opens the face a touch, and sends it behind point...too much width
an off-target bouncer down the leg side...Umesh needs to lift here
short of a length outside off, nicely on his toes and punches through the covers...deep point in place now
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, makes a late decision to leave alone...this one doesn't bounce much
top shot! He's driven very well in this match, gets forward to a full delivery on off stump and sends it straight down the ground, past the on side of the stumps. Doesn't get better
this is loose, though! His eyes light up at some width, aims a flashing square drive and the ball scoots over the top edge
play and miss again! He's going for his shots. Aims another cut, the ball is too close to him as it angles in...there's an appeal for a catch behind
fuller, he goes for the drive and gets a thick inside edge into his pads
finds the outside edge with a full delivery from round the wicket, played with soft hands and it runs wide of the slips to third man...Khawaja doubles his boundary count for the series
a lovely piece of timing, Shami gets too straight and it's elegantly flicked off the pads through square leg...no stopping Usman, now
full outside off, driven to cover
a short ball outside off, he goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge into his boot...looks like Australia have decided to play a few shots
that's a better delivery, bit more effort, extra bounce outside off but he plays it well, keeping it down through gully off the shoulder of the bat
good length, angled in from round the wicket, left alone
full outside off, nicely forward and drives between cover and mid-off
more sweet timing off the pads, too straight, flicked through midwicket and Australia's lead is up to 100
beaten by a fuller one, in the spot outside off, Khawaja playing forward. Good carry
short of a length, allowed to go through
outside off, left alone
fuller, at off stump, 138kph, driven into the covers
round the wicket, full at middle and off, tucked through midwicket
left alone and he's bowled! Good length from round the wicket, Harris thought this would shape away (or he just got it badly wrong) lifts the bat out of the line and off stump is clipped
comes over the wicket to Marsh, takes him on the pads but that pitched outside leg
don't think he had a clue there! A full delivery, just outside off, Marsh is shuffling all over the crease, starts to leave, then starts to play, then eventually leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, left alone...awesome atmosphere at the moment
pads up to this one but it's too high for lbw, and may have pitched outside leg...a short of a length delivery. Marsh all over the shop
full outside off, left alone
this zips through to Pant, takes it at head height from a full length...plenty happening
touch shorter in length, through to the keeper
137kph, outside off, left alone...needs to make him play
short of a length, gets on his toes and defends to the off side
fuller, at off stump, defended to the bowler
full, outside off, and this one scuttles through to Pant
length ball at the stumps, worked through square leg to get him out of the firing line
back of a length, angled in at off stump, defeats Khawaja and takes him high above the pads
short of a length outside off, 144kph, touch of extra bounce and Khawaja plays it well by taking his bottom hand off the bat
full at off stump, defended
short of a length outside off, left alone
flashed over the gully as he goes after a short delivery with some width, certainly not in control but gets it down to third man
fuller, outside off, left alone and taken at ankle height
over the wicket, back of a length outside off, left alone
a bouncer over leg stump, travels over his back
under edge on a pull! India are alive...a short ball, angled across outside off, Marsh goes for a pull, would have been fetching it quite a lot, and can only get a thin bottom edge
challenges the off stump first ball, calmly defended on the back foot to mid-on
good length at off stump, pushed towards mid-on
full and straight, playing from the crease, worked to midwicket...doesn't want to miss that
taken on the pad this time as he moves across the crease, flicks down the leg side
full outside off, he's so far back in his crease, rolls off the outside edge towards gully
short of a length outside off, he seems more comfortable against that length because he's naturally set up for the shorter delivery...defended to cover
just gets the line wrong this time, angled into the pads, flicked away fine
round the wicket, short of a length, defended to the leg side
left alone outside off
wider outside off, he doesn't play
a bouncer outside off, doesn't pose any problems
angled into the hip, worked to long leg
slashed high over the slips! Not unlike his first-innings dismissal, short of a length outside off, not in control but takes a thick top edge to third man
what a ripper, there's no playing that, good length from round the wicket, leaps as it straightens and beats the outside edge
glanced down the leg side, just out of reach of a diving Pant and it's given runs...angled into the pads, tickled away very fine
worked from off stump to the leg side
across to off stump, angles into him, defended to mid-on
beats the edge again, Khawaja just pushing away from his body, another one which nips off the seam
touch too straight, worked off the pads wide of long leg
full outside off, he's fishing at it with his feet stuck in the crease
a short ball, he sends it very high in the air as he pulls behind square but it's well away from any fielders
back on a full length outside off, defended to the covers
back of a length at off stump, played out to point not entirely convincingly
full at the stumps, worked to mid-on
well across his stumps and shovels a straight delivery backward of square
and strikes first ball! The full one does for Handscomb, and that looked on the cards. Full and straight, Handscomb so far back on his stumps, he could basically have walked for that
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
full at off stump, pushed to mid-off
that's a terrific shot, of a man in form, nicely into position as he drives through the covers..oops, Bumrah has managed to tread on the boundary as he collects this
late seam movement on this one outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, left alone

129kph angled down leg and it keeps swinging wide of Pant's outstretched glove! No way he could stop that. Four byes
big swing and miss driving with no footwork outside off
130kph short and widen he upper cuts brilliantly behind point into the gap! What a stroke from Hazlewood
play and miss, good delivery, back of a length, angled in and leaving him, he fends and misses
sliced just short of gully! He drove away from his body and it just fell short of Rahane who knocks it down but they run on the ricochet
134kph, short and wide and a big flash and miss trying to cut
angled in full and he whips wide of fine leg! Another great shot. Too full and straight and he flicked with the angle to the big gap wide of long leg
play and miss wide of off trying to drive at a ball leaving him
135kph, full, almost a half volley, feet anchored, he drags a drive to mid on
late cuts up and over gully between third man and deep backward point! Great shot. He rocked back and late cut the short wide one. Placed it perfectly
short ball, closer to off, he didn't pick it up early but swayed out of the way falling backwards
137kph, full, top of off, he defends to cover-point who is a bit deep and they run one, Starc was unsure initially but he responded eventually and there was an easy one
132kph, beats the edge with another that just leaves him off the surface
129kph, short and wide and carved up and over point into the vacant outfield, there's no one back, point was up, they run well
shorter and tighter to off, he's up on his toes bunting this nicely to the gap at cover
good length, off stump line, he defends from the crease into the off side
high bouncer, he sways underneath and it's called wide for being too high!
134kph, back of a length on off, he forced firmly off the back foot to mid off
shorter outside off, it's a bit close to cut but he does well to get it away through point to the man in the deep
edged and wide of second slip, it runs fine of third man Bumrah can't stop the boundary! It was a thick edge to a length ball and Kohli diving full stretch to his left couldn't get there
back of a length on middle, he punches nicely off the back foot to deep point
bowled him! The change of angle works. Fast spearing into the top of off stump and he is stuck on the crease flailing at it, beaten for sheer pace and it cannons into the top of off
beats him, good length first up, angled across, he tries to defend on the front foot and it beats the edge
143kph, good length, well wide of off, he's happy to leave, good bounce and carry to Paine
143kph, back of a length, wide of off, he leaves this alone

chopped on! He tried to leave and didn't withdraw the bat in time! It ricochet's onto the stumps! It was a good length inwinger, fifth stump line, he tried to leave but left the bat dangling, it hit the bottom edge and cannoned into the stumps!
146kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone, it flies through to Paine
143kph, good length, zipping through, he keeps the bat inside the line, and it flies through to Paine
133kph, good length outswinger, he's defending from the crease off the outside half of the bat to point
138kph, shorter into the hip, he works this away taking his bottom hand off the bat but controls it around the corner to fine leg
135kph, good length and steep bounce, catches him on the gloves as he knocks it into the off side. Pretty well played
137kph, good length, sixth stump line, hint of shape away, he is happy to leave through to the the keeper
137kph, shorter outswinger, well wide and swinger wider, he has no interest in playing
134kph, shorter length wide of off, he defends playing away from his body but with control to the gully
139kph, back of a length, across the right hander, he leaves this through to the keeper
this flies over the keeper's head from a length! Just a good length ball outside off, he leaves and it takes off and sails over Paine's outstretched glove! Goodness
144kph, good length fifth stump line, assured leave on the front foot
141kph, short of a length outside off, he defends away from his body into the gully
141kph, wide and full and lovely square drive behind point! This was well controlled, opened the blade and places it into the gap
149kph, good bouncer, he ducks under it early and flies through to the keeper
edged along the ground wide of gully and away! This was 140kph, perfect length, on off, he's half forward with soft hands and gets a thick edge that races past gully
138kph, good length fourth stump line, he defends from the crease on the front foot
139kph, good length, outswinger, wide of off, he leaves this alone
138kph, shorter length, lifting from a length, he watches and knocks it down off the gloves! That was nasty. So well played by Pujara

caught behind! Another brute! This was a superb delivery. Again a good length outside off and he gets steep bounce, Pujara plays from the crease, it flicks the bottom glove as he fends at it, it flies through to Paine who takes the simple catch.
144kph, bouncer, at the body, he ducks under it well
141kph, back of a length outside off, he defends from the crease into the off side
145kph, good length across the right hander he watches it fly through to the keeper
drives and misses, again a good length, not a half volley, it goes with the angle, he drives and it zips past the edge
136kph, high bouncer, it flies very high, he ducks underneath it and Paine jumps up to save it with one glove
142kph, good length outside off, he pushes decisively on the front foot to wide mid on
full swinging into the pads, 141kph, he glances this neatly to long leg
145kph, short into the hip, inside edge onto thigh it pops up but no short leg there to catch it!
good length, fifth stump line, he leaves and it nips back a touch but wide of off
139kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone through to the keeper
137kph, wide of the crease, he angles into off, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
edges but short of second slip. Perfect length outside off, he pushes forward gets the edge and it falls well short of slip
back of a length outside off, he rises with the bounce and forces off the back foot to point
fuller length, outside off, he he drives nicely to mid off
full outside off, he comes forward and plays to point
he flaps at this a little outside off, short of a length, but keeps it down wide of gully...didn't look entirely convincing
a short ball, in the channel outside off, Vijay sways out of the line
short of a length, nips back at 136kph, takes him on the thigh guard
back of a length, straight, 140kph, touch of extra bounce and he takes the bottom hand off the bat
this one beats the outside edge, just back of a length outside off, think Vijay had a nibble
good length at middle and off, 137kph, defended to mid-on
wider outside off, back of a length, left alone
fuller, tempting the drive, he allows it to go through
too wide this time, left alone
dropped in short and he's so quickly onto the pull, sends it well in front of square
some uncertainty this time, back on a full length outside off, he goes to leave it and the ball runs off the face towards second slip
that's a terrific shot, leans into a full delivery and drives it wide of the diving mid-off
drags the length, just outside off, that's a reasonably tight leave
full at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
beaten this time, back of a length outside off, this keeps a little low
a bouncer which loses direction, down the leg side, dips as it reaches Paine and he can only palm it away
short of a length outside off, takes the splice as Kohli jabs at it little with quite hard hands
full length outside off, 140kph, left alone
touch fuller, good carry through to Paine above his head
back of a length outside off, offers to come back, a well-judged leave
a shorter delivery, angled in at the hip, turned behind square
excellent delivery, good length and nips back off the seam (and maybe a crack), beats the inside edge and takes him high on the back leg
back and across onto off stump, defends to point
short of a length outside off, 137kph, this keeps climbing through to the keeper
taps a length ball into midwicket, just wide of short leg and they scamper what could have been a risky single
short of a length outside off, 140kph, jumps across the crease and defends to point
onto his toes against a short delivery, defends to the off side
gets inside the line and flicks into midwicket
has a fiddle at this one outside off, suggestion it kept low, scuttles through to Paine and isn't taken cleanly
trademark Kohli as he leans forward into a drive, mid-off is able to chase it down near the rope
this is left on length as much as line, almost went over the top of off stump
full at the stumps, defended back to the bowler
lovely piece of timing, takes a stride forward and punches this with not much more than a defensive push through the covers
an terrific short ball in response, shapes back at Vijay who sways out of the line
back of a length, just outside off, left alone and Hazlewood has his hands on his head...two types of leave
flaps at this outside off, he's done that a couple of times, but is able to keep the ball down towards point
full and straight, a nicely-timed on-side punch but mid-on is able to get across
back of a length at middle and off, 140kph, defended back from where it came
that's a very sharp short ball, flies over Kohli's bat as he aborts his pull shot at the last moment. Ball got very big on him
top shot! Full at middle and off, clipped beautifully through midwicket. Timing and placement
full, wide outside off with some swing, left alone
length ball, straight, worked to short leg who is Handscomb with Finch off the field
wider outside off, he brings out the paddle-sweep and finds short fine leg
stretches forward and defends to the off side
goes for the sweep again, this goes squarer and again Cummins cuts it off behind square
straighter, on middle and off, worked to the leg side
pushes out in front of his pad, keeps the ball down. Tidy start from Lyon
back of a length at middle and off, the bat face closes a little as he defends
goes very full outside off, Kohli strides forward and drives to deep point...Australia have cover in the deep now
short of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length and nips back, staying a fraction leg side of the ball as he defends to cover
another good-looking drive, placed wide of cover, a comfortable brace to keep things ticking
back of a length outside off, pushed firmly to sub (M Marsh) at cover
spins into the pads, looks to work it away and nearly gets a leading edge
worked off the pads past short leg, midwicket does the work
back and across, flicked to the leg side
deep in the crease and whips a shorter delivery into midwicket
works a straight delivery off his pads to backward square leg
flicked off the stumps to short leg...a much straighter line in that over from Lyon
back of a length at off stump, defended
good length outside off, left alone
a short ball which he ducks underneath
gets forward and defends solidly to cover
a lovely flowing cover drive, but a dive by Lyon at point prevents a boundary...big stride forward into the shot
back of a length at middle and off, defended
back and across, whips a shortish delivery to deep midwicket
this is wider outside off, he goes for the sweep and misses...outside the line for the lbw shout
more spin from the wider line, cannons into the front pad as he gets well forward
straighter, swept very firmly off the stumps to short fine leg
short outside off, he plays back and mistimes his drive
gets forward to a length delivery outside off...Lyon looks more threatening with that line
over the wicket, pushed across outside off, left alone
touch closer to off stump, good length, carries at head height to Paine
fuller, still hanging it outside off, left alone
short, wide outside off, through to keeper...not quite the best start from Starc
this one is on the stumps, full, driven back to the bowler
stretches forward into a full delivery, skews it into midwicket, it's a sharp single but the pick up isn't clean

edged, taken at slip, the GOAT has the big one! It's that line outside off that's done the trick, brings Kohli forward, there's some natural variation as it goes on with the arm, takes the edge and a neat, low catch at slip
full at off stump, defended coming forward
aggression as he comes down the pitch, he's not quite to the ball, flicks into square leg
onto the front foot and defends
shorter, outside off, onto the back foot and plays to the off
nicely bowled, Vijay gets a little squared up by this one, seamed to straighten late on him
full outside off, driven to backward point
in the channel just outside off, left alone
nearly drags this one, a length ball outside off, pushing at it, takes a thick inside edge down by his feet and bobbles OVER the timber
take that! He throws the kitchen sink into this drive, full and quite wide, no holding back and sends it in the air over point
short of a length, on middle and leg, defended into square leg
back of a length at off stump, defended with an open face towards gully
wide line outside, Rahane thrusts forward...worth a silly point?
uses his feet, nicely to the pitch, drives wide of mid-off
swept from outside off to backward square leg
defended wide of silly point

through the gate, the dream offspinner's wicket! Poor shot from Vijay, but credit Lyon for tempting the stroke. Tossed wider into the footmarks, hits one in the middle, Vijay is aiming through the covers, takes an inside edge into leg stump.
defended to the leg side
back of a length, straight, defended
just over third man! A man was down there, Rahane threw his hands into an uppercut, went over the slips, and just over Mitchell Marsh's head. Did he know the man was there?
short of a length, slams into the splice of the bat
a short, rapid delivery outside off, had a thought about pulling but left it alone...Australia well and truly finding their voice again
on the pads, worked through square leg
full outside off, doesn't get very far forward as he defends
straight, tucked to the leg side
back outside off stump, this one doesn't spin, dabbed through backward point
full, gets well forward and defends to silly point
drags this down short outside off, cut away but that's good back-up in the field as Cummins dives across from point
uses his feet and pushes back to Lyon who then shapes to throw the ball but holds on
forward outside off, defended
148kph, rocket, hits a length wide of off and takes off, he's happy to watch it fly through to Paine
149kph, full and trying to work back in but it's too wide, he leaves this alone
147kph, back of a length, wide of off, he fends this away from his body wide of gully to third man
146kph, wider of off, not a half volley, he tries to lash a drive on the up, but drags it off the inside half of the bat to midwicket
151kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends jumping back and across
152kph, angled into middle, good length, he defends from the crease with the angle to midwicket
he sweeps hard from outside off and hammers it behind square! Powerful positive stroke. He nailed that.
pushed through quicker and fuller, he works just square of midwicket, and Harris has a lot of work to do from deep square
floated up outside off, he defends stretching on the front foot
well wide of off, he stretches out and paddle sweeps fine! Tremendous shot using the pace and placing fine of the man in the deep
beaten fending at a shorter one that doesn't spin outside off. Natural variation there
good length, drifting away and spinning back, he's back and defending with an open face
good length on off, he defends to the gap at cover and they run well to pinch one. Head tries to run out Vihari with a throw at the striker's end but he was well home
fuller length, angled into off, he drives positively to mid on
134kph, shorter ball, well wide of off, he is happy to watch this fly through to Paine
136kph, good length, this climbs from a length, catches him on the gloves as he defends from the crease, but he knocks it down
135kph, bouncer, this climbs again, he went to ride it but it gets big and just goes past the gloves, off the shirt through to Paine
139kph, back of a length, tailing into off, he's back and across and working forward of square on the leg side
tossed up outside off, he skips out and pushes back to the bowler
good length, he's caught on the crease defending with soft hands
pushed through quicker, he defends from the back foot again
floated up outside off, he stretches forward and defends to silly mid off
advances and gets to the pitch, driving down to long on
89kph, tossed up, he skips down and works to long on with ease
140kph, back of a length, he's back and up on his toes and knocking it into the off side
141kph, overpitched and he leans into a comfortable drive placing it through cover
137kph, bouncer, he tries to hook but it climbs over the gloves, Paine flies high to his left to take it
138kph, good length, he is half forward defending on the front foot
136kph, shorter length into the ribs, he's back and knocking this forward of square leg
edge falls short of second slip. Good length fourth stump line, he defends from the crease but with soft hands and it goes well short of Handscomb
shorter length, he's back and working to square leg but it hits Handscomb at short leg and he knocks it down
short, he pulls off the edge onto body but it falls safe on the off side
pitching into the footmark, he pads up, it comes off pad, bounces up onto his raised bat and drops down
skips down and gets a thick edge well wide of slip and it races to the third man boundary! Well bowled. It was natural variation that caught the edge
perfect length, he presses forward and defends off the sticker of the bat as it spits up
shorter and wider, he rocks back quickly and cuts very well through the gap at point. Nicely played
137kph, good length angled into leg stump, he's back and tucking this around the corner to fine leg
132kph, good length, he's forward and pushing firmly to wide mid off
135kph, bouncer, quite high, he ducks underneath it
139kph, tailing in fuller, he drives to mid on with the full face
short lifter, 136kph, outside off, he drops the knees and sways underneath it
134kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and working this through midwicket
132kph, full tailing in and he clips this easily through a vacant mid on! No mid on and a short leg and he dishes up a half volley. Nice stroke
132kph, nearly ducks into a bouncer that shoots low! It was short, he ducked and dropped the hands and it came through stump high, just past off stump
shorter length, he rises with the length and plays a solid back foot defence
135kph, back of a length angled into off, he's back and defending into the off side
136kph, shorter length outside off, he's up on his toes pushing this wide of gully to third man
136kph, high bouncer, too high and called a wide
133kph, back of a length, off stump line, he's back and defending this with one hand off the bat to cover
139kph, wide of the crease, angled into off stump, he drives firmly to mid on
134kph, good length, fifth stump line, he presses forward and defends to mid off
136kph, good length, targeting off stump, he defends solidly from the crease to mid on
132kph, bouncer, well directed, he ducks underneath it well
137kph, good length nipping in, gets a thin inside edge and hits the back thigh and rolls away
137kph, fuller length, he tries to drive but mistimes to mid off
134kph, good length, well wide of off and he's happy to leave this alone
137kph, good length off stump line, he defends from the crease to mid off
138kph, good length, middle and off line, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
133kph, short ball, head high, he hooks, taking his high off it but he strikes it well to wide fine leg
good length on middle, he calmly knocks this past short leg to midwicket
138kph, good length, swinging away a touch, he does well not to be tempted to play
133kph, shorter length, wide of off, he late cuts nicely but can't beat Khawaja at gully
137kph, cracking bouncer, he shaped to hook and it got big on him and flew over his head as he just ducked late
135kph, shorter length, nipping into the thigh guard and it drops down
134kph, good length, he hangs back but defends comfortably enough

caught at point! Great catch by Head! This was a fuller length but he offered width, Rahane leans back and hammers a square drive with his weight back, he hit it flat, straight at Head who was looking into the setting sun but took at excellent catch above his cap.
146kph, bouncer, high down leg, he ducks under it and thuds into Paine's gloves. That was so much quicker than the rest of the over
he sweeps from off the stumps and it comes off gloves and rolls away. He exposed the stumps there
shorter outside off, he pushes off the back foot to cover-point
85kph, shorter outside off, he steps back and across to defend
pitching in the footmarks wide of off, he paddle sweeps to short fine leg
tossed up wide of off, he drives very nicely wide of mid off and Hazlewood makes a diving save
short and wide, he cuts hard to deep point. 100 is up for India
beats him with 136kph, good length outside off, he pressed forward to defend and it just straightened off the seam
138kph, shorter length, nipping in and hits him on the hip and he doubles over
beats the edge again. Perfect length, fourth stump line, 139kph, it straightens off the seam again and flies past the edge
140kph, fuller outside off, and he drives, mistiming this into the gap at cover
139kph, short ball on off, he stays still and defends off the back foot with the full face
139kph, short into the hip, he gets this off the gloves fine but along the ground and well away from Paine and it runs all the way to the rope
short and wide, he's back and cutting hard to deep cover point
pushed through outside off, he's back and forcing this to cover-point
full and drifting away and skidding away off the pitch, he leaves and Paine takes it well
tossed up, he drives fluently to cover
tossed well wide off, he is happy to leave this alone
drifting into off, he stretches forward and defends
thick leading edge in the air for awhile but it flies well safe of Lyon at point. He pushed very hard at that popping it through cover-point
141kph, good length, wide of off stump, he leaves this alone
shorter into the hip, 139kph, he works this nicely down to fine leg off the front foot
142kph, short ball down the leg side, he tries to pull but can't catch up with it
142kph, short ball, fourth stump line, he rises up on his toes and knocks this down well
145kph, short ball way down the leg side and he's happy to let it go
87kph, drifting into middle, he gets a thick inside edge that runs down to fine leg and they run well to get two
86kph, drifting in and straightening but it's wide enough to leave
nearly caught at midwicket! He skips down and tries to heave this into the long on stands, and drags it just short of midwicket who dives forward and can't get there, it gets past him for one
tossed up, he defends on the front foot
shorter length, he goes back and defends on the back foot
89kph, drifting outside off, he leaves, it spits viciously and hits Paine on the shoulder! That bounced very high from a length
141kph, angled down leg side, he misses out on the glance and Paine takes it rolling to his right
140kph, short and very wide, Pant is happy to let that go
prods and misses wide of off. He pushes at a wider length ball, and it beat the outside edge
143kph, tries to drive a length ball, it hits the splice of the bat and rolls to cover
139kph, fuller length outside off, he mistimes a drive to mid off
143kph, searing yorker and he keeps it out well! Well played
wide outside off, left alone
gets forward outside off, whips it down the ground to long-on
round the wicket, short of a length, played off the back foot
slides on outside off, left alone
gets forward and defends to the off side
short outside off, spins away, pushed into the covers
short of a length outside off, left alone
fuller, at off stump, he plays forward and gets an inside edge behind square
full at off stump, he gets forward and pushes to mid-on
fuller, at the stumps, hint of late swing and flicked to mid-on
wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, a strong square drive out to deep point
full at off stump, stretches forward and defends
beats him outside off with one that spins, Pant playing forward again
this is a fraction shorter and goes on with the arm, defended on the back foot
he misreads the length here, plays back to quite a full delivery, takes an inside edge and scuttles to the leg side
back and across on off stump, defended
fuller, touch wider outside off, brings him onto the front foot
back of a length at off stump, Pant is squared up a touch as he defends to point
short of a length on off stump, defended
pushed wide outside off, left alone
full, at off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, carries to Paine at shin height
that's a good one, beats the edge as it climbs from back of a length, past the shoulder of the bat
back of a length outside off, defended
stretches out to play a paddle-sweep, very wide outside off, taken on the pad
uses his feet, Lyon sends this wider and he really has to reach for this
shorter outside off, punched from the back foot down the pitch
uses his feet again, isn't to the pitch, this spins and beats the inside edge, taking the front pad
makes connection with this sweep, taken from wide outside off, finds deep square
short outside off, he drops his hands and lets it go through
short at the body, worked off the hip, may have taken some glove as well
full outside off, he comes forward, played with an open face wide of gully
short of a length at off stump, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends
gets across to off stump, defended on the back foot

inside edge, loops to midwicket! Australia have their breakthrough. Short of a length on leg stump, looks to tuck it away, the edge bounds off the thigh pad and carries all the way to Harris at midwicket
goes for the big shot, here's our answer, tossed up outside off, aims to launch it over the off side and it falls short of deep cover. Declines the run
pushed more calmly into the off side
left alone outside off
short of a length outside off, he's on the back foot and punches to deep cover...takes the run this time
forward outside off, prodded to silly point
pushed into the off side
full outside off, playing from the crease, takes a thick outside edge along the ground to gully
tucks a back-of-a-length delivery towards deep square and it's place well enough for a second
good-looking drive as he comes forward, played down to long-off and he doesn't run
full and wide, driven into the covers and he presses for the second...a better throw to Starc and Umesh was short
short of a length at off stump, takes the splice of the bat...looks for the single but it's not on
short outside off, he throws his hands into the cut, flies off the top edge over the slips and fine of third...Australia will take that
lunges forward outside off and pushes with hard hands
flashes and misses outside off
pushed to backward point
full outside off, defended
beats the outside edge with the ball that goes with the arm
touch shorter, worked to short leg
back of a length at off stump, worked down to long leg and turns down the run
short outside off, guides it down to third man, was in the air but right between the lone slip and gully
short, down the leg side, misses his pull
short outside off, flashes this over gully, there's nearly a collision on the boundary between Harris and Lyon but the four is saved and no one is hurt
short of a length, jabbed into the covers
terrific short ball, climbs at Pant, fended off the shoulder of the bat through gully who had just been moved
that's a fierce drive as he comes down the pitch and creams this to the right of long-off
prods forward outside off
thrusts forward with bat in front of pad
fuller, outside off, whipped back to the bowler
stretches forward and defends past silly point
just evades short leg as this flies off a thick inside edge as Yadav lunges forward
short of a length, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he fends to the leg side
tucked into midwicket, sets off quickly to try and get the second but there's no chance
that's a sharp short ball, 140kph, flies off his back
short, down the leg side, goes for the pull and ends up flat on his back side in the crease
big appeal for lbw, may be pitched outside leg, could have been high as well...Umesh shuffling across the crease, ball didn't really get up. Well, was missing off stump as well
fuller, outside off, pushed towards mid-off so he sees out the over
that's neatly cut away, fully in control of that, waited for it outside off and placed it fine of backward point
goes on with the arm, defends on the back foot
left alone outside off, tempted for another cut

fantastic catch at midwicket! Lyon wins again, and Australia have almost won. Pant came down the pitch, tried to heave this through the leg side, loses his shape and drags it in the air towards midwicket. Handscomb dives full length to his left, that's a ripper of a catch

big appeal for caught behind first ball, the straighter one from Lyon, Australia very confident but they decline to review. Missed it by a long way. Paine says it might have been boot on ground whatever he heard
defended into backward point
takes a blow on the helmet as he ducks into a short ball, turned his head away from the line
he's not getting in line there! Moves miles outside leg then heaves across the line of a short-of-a-length delivery
he's miles outside leg stump again, manages to turn this to short leg...get one at the stumps! That was 150kph. Lively
he's not liking this, Umesh, as he turns his head away from the ball and it flies off the splice through square leg...getting a working over
goes for the yorker, fair play to Umesh, he stays in line and digs out into the covers

that was coming, pops a short ball back to the bowler! That was a vicious working over from one fast bowler to another. Umesh backing away this time, a short of a length ball hammers into the splice and loops to the on side...Starc has time to get across from his follow through
starts with a short ball...called wide
short again but makes him play this time, defended to the leg side
backs away to the leg side and has a slog at a short delivery
caught behind! It's one to go. Ishant backing away outside leg, a short-of-a-length delivery, a thin top edge as he tries to carve through the off side
backing to leg, goes for a swing over the leg side, doesn't make contact
short again, another swing and a miss
there it is! Victory for Australia...Bumrah launches this high in the air, Cummins settles under it in his follow through. Job done
